str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
Two. A primary numeral; 'two'.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To be sitting, sit down, be seated. From kata and the base of hedraios; to sit down.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
